name: SetEntityInWorld
description: Assigns an entity to a specific world. Entities must be in a world to be visible and interactive to players.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The entity to assign to the world

parameters.name: world
parameters.description: The world to assign the entity to

returns.description: This function does not return a value

example:
-- Create a world and assign player to it
local gameWorld = CreateWorld(32, 32)
FillBlocksInWorld(gameWorld, vec3(0, 0, 0), vec3(31, 1, 31))

AddEventListener("onPlayerJoin", function(player)
    local playerEntity = GetPlayerEntity(player)
    SetEntityInWorld(playerEntity, gameWorld)
    SetEntityCoords(playerEntity, vec3(16, 2, 16))
end)
notes: Entities can only be in one world at a time
Moving an entity to a new world removes it from the previous world
Players will only see blocks and entities in their current world
The world must exist before assigning entities to it
